content:
Does the Ctrl+ Enter key combination/shortcut work to send mail?

As you provide so little information I have to try and establish if it is just a virsual where the send toolbar button is not visible, the toolbar itself is is not visible or send later has appeared because Thunderbird in not in online mode.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: The toolbar itself is not visible since the update a couple of days ago. Didn't know about the control enter trick and that works fine. Thanks for your help. I have an older computer with Thunderbird not updated to the latest version and that still has the toolbar. At least now I can send emails even though the other is much better.
creator: banders1

content: Is there a way to reestablish the toolbar in the new version?
creator: banders1

content:
bellist said
I can't find a way to create a new contact list. The help says to go to the "File" menu. I don't see a file menu.

The menu bar has been turned off by default in Windows versions of Thunderbird since 2012 See https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/display-thunderbird-menus-and-toolbar

An online search for “Thunderbird add contact list” suggested I click on "New List." I don't see it.

Are you in the addressbook?

It is the icon/glyph to the right of the new contact button.

I just updated to version 128.14.0esr (64 bit). I don't see the missing menus in this version either.

See my first comment and linked article. Menus by default are something from before 2012. So they will not "just appear" unless you turn the menu bar on.
creator: MattAuSupport
